Comment: I think most of us were already aware of his unwillingness here to not just defy multiple court orders, but do the appropriate thing...  > President Trump... said he does have the ability to help return the wrongly deported Maryland man, but is not willing to do so because he believes he is a gang member.  > “You could get him back, there’s a phone on this desk,” said Terry Moran, an ABC News correspondent, noting a Supreme Court order to “facilitate” the release of Mr. Abrego Garcia.  > “I could,” Mr. Trump replied.  Yea, you *could* abide by the multiple court rulings that have ordered Garcia's return, or the court orders that have determined your actions unconstitutional. You *could* listen to a majority of the American public who disagree with the way you've handled this fiasco. You *could* stop spreading lies and misinformation. You *could* stop threatening judges and overstepping your authority.   You *could* stop using inflammatory rhetoric to rationalize your administration's unlawful actions. You *could* stop throwing people into unmarked vehicles or unlawfully detaining and deporting legal residents, children and U.S. citizens. You *could* stop using non-gang affiliated tattoos and clothing as grounds for deportation.   You *could* stop stripping people of their rights while  shipping alleged "gang members" with no criminal records to Guantanamo bay and abroad to one of the most dangerous prisons on earth.  You *could* stop defying court orders and invoking archaic laws to pursue the deliberate mistreatment of "undesirables." You *could* stop unconstitutionally profiling and targeting visa holders, asylum seekers, green card carriers, foreign students, protestors, U.S. residents and migrants protected from deportation, especially those critical of your administration's policies and those who you've so presciently mischaracterized as "criminals" because they either fit a convenient stereotype or don't subscribe to your cult's philosophy...  You *could* and *should* do these things, but you won't because you obviously care about these people just as much as you care about the constitution and the rule of law...
Author: Choice-of-SteinsGate

Comment: Trump doesn’t understand a lot of things.  The most important thing he doesn’t understand is that deciding who gets incarcerated is not an executive branch decision. In particular, it’s not his decision.   Courts, through due process, decide.  If we lose that we lose everything.  So this issue is non-negotiable.    Further, if he keeps pushing this it’s Congress’s sworn duty to impeach and remove him.  They all swore an oath to defend the constitution against all enemies, foreign **and domestic.**  Some leeway in the matter is appropriate, but as time marches on the evidence that Trump is an enemy of the constitution keeps building.  Soon lines are going to be drawn and it’s going to be patriots vs rebels again.    Any Democrat unable to be loudly on the patriot side soon needs to be replaced with someone wiling to fight for our nation.
